page.title: 08Living by Garway Hill
page.content: My house is opposite a lane that leads to a footpath to the top of Garway Hill. From the top of the hill you can see for miles. On a clear day you can see the Bristol Channel, Gloucester, Ross, Hereford, Monmouth, the Malverns, and many hills in Wales. At the very top there is a pill box, which was put there in the Second World War as an anti-aircraft gun emplacement. Next to it there is a white stone with some numbers on it. This is a triangulation point. The top of the hill is 1200ft. above sea level. Near the top there is a pond that the horses drink from. Sometimes people fly model aeroplanes or kites on the hill. There is also a scrambling track. I ride my BMX bike on it. I like going over jumps, and going down into dips and up the other side.
